title: 10g Slow Pour Single Stream
preparation_steps: Add coffee to V60 and tare scale

brewing_steps.audio_script: Start timer. Pour 30 grams for the bloom. Wait 30 seconds. Simple start.
Now, for the main event. Pour the remaining 140 grams in one, single, ultra-slow continuous stream. This should take you about 2 minutes of pouring. Keep the stream thread-thin.
Once you reach 170 grams, let it draw down. The continuous flow maintains a constant temperature and saturation.

what_to_expect.description: A counter-intuitive but effective method for micro-doses. Using one extremely slow, continuous pour (osmotic flow style) keeps the bed perfectly stable and fully saturated, preventing both clogging and bypass.
what_to_expect.audio_script: It feels wrong, but it works. By pouring in one ultra-slow, continuous stream, you maintain perfect saturation and temperature without agitating the bed, resulting in a sweet, unclogged brew.

notes: Counterintuitive but works: one ultra-slow pour prevents bypass and clogging better than multiple fast pours with small doses.
